trans-unit.source: Using operating system commands with the freeze and unfreeze system procedures to perform an online backup

seg-source.mrk: Using operating system commands with the freeze and unfreeze system procedures to perform an online backup

target.mrk: Using operating system commands with the freeze and unfreeze system procedures to perform an online backup

trans-unit.source: Typically, these procedures are used to speed up the copy operation involved in an online backup.

seg-source.mrk: Typically, these procedures are used to speed up the copy operation involved in an online backup.

target.mrk: Typically, these procedures are used to speed up the copy operation involved in an online backup.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not perform the copy operation for you. You use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_FREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> procedure to lock the database, and then you explicitly copy the database directory by using operating system commands.

seg-source.mrk: In this scenario, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not perform the copy operation for you.
You use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_FREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> procedure to lock the database, and then you explicitly copy the database directory by using operating system commands.

target.mrk: In this scenario, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not perform the copy operation for you.
You use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_FREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> procedure to lock the database, and then you explicitly copy the database directory by using operating system commands.

trans-unit.source: For example, because the UNIX <codeph>tar</codeph> command uses operating system file-copying routines, and the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE</codeph> procedure uses Java I/O calls with additional internal synchronization that allow updates during the backup, the <codeph>tar</codeph> command might provide faster backups than the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE</codeph> procedure.

seg-source.mrk: For example, because the UNIX <codeph>tar</codeph> command uses operating system file-copying routines, and the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE</codeph> procedure uses Java I/O calls with additional internal synchronization that allow updates during the backup, the <codeph>tar</codeph> command might provide faster backups than the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE</codeph> procedure.

target.mrk: For example, because the UNIX <codeph>tar</codeph> command uses operating system file-copying routines, and the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE</codeph> procedure uses Java I/O calls with additional internal synchronization that allow updates during the backup, the <codeph>tar</codeph> command might provide faster backups than the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_BACKUP_DATABASE</codeph> procedure.

trans-unit.source: To use operating system commands for online database backups, call the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_FREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> system procedure. The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_FREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> system procedure puts the database into a state in which it can be safely copied. After the database has been copied, use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UNFREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> system procedure to continue working with the database. Only after <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UNFREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> has been specified can transactions once again write to the database. Read operations can proceed while the database is frozen.

seg-source.mrk: To use operating system commands for online database backups, call the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_FREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> system procedure.
The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_FREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> system procedure puts the database into a state in which it can be safely copied.
After the database has been copied, use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UNFREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> system procedure to continue working with the database.
Only after <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UNFREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> has been specified can transactions once again write to the database.
Read operations can proceed while the database is frozen.

target.mrk: To use operating system commands for online database backups, call the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_FREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> system procedure.
The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_FREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> system procedure puts the database into a state in which it can be safely copied.
After the database has been copied, use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UNFREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> system procedure to continue working with the database.
Only after <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UNFREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> has been specified can transactions once again write to the database.
Read operations can proceed while the database is frozen.

trans-unit.source: To ensure a consistent backup of the database, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> might block applications that attempt to write to a frozen database until the backup is completed and the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UNFREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> system procedure is called.

seg-source.mrk: To ensure a consistent backup of the database, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> might block applications that attempt to write to a frozen database until the backup is completed and the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UNFREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> system procedure is called.

target.mrk: To ensure a consistent backup of the database, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> might block applications that attempt to write to a frozen database until the backup is completed and the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UNFREEZE_DATABASE</codeph> system procedure is called.

trans-unit.source: The following example demonstrates how the freeze and unfreeze procedures are used to surround an operating system copy command:

seg-source.mrk: The following example demonstrates how the freeze and unfreeze procedures are used to surround an operating system copy command:

target.mrk: The following example demonstrates how the freeze and unfreeze procedures are used to surround an operating system copy command:

trans-unit.source: public static void backUpDatabaseWithFreeze(Connection conn) throws SQLException { Statement s = conn.createStatement(); s.executeUpdate( "CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_FREEZE_DATABASE()"); //copy the database directory during this interval s.executeUpdate( "CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UNFREEZE_DATABASE()"); s.close(); }

seg-source.mrk: public static void backUpDatabaseWithFreeze(Connection conn) throws SQLException { Statement s = conn.createStatement(); s.executeUpdate( "CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_FREEZE_DATABASE()"); //copy the database directory during this interval s.executeUpdate( "CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UNFREEZE_DATABASE()"); s.close(); }

target.mrk: public static void backUpDatabaseWithFreeze(Connection conn) throws SQLException { Statement s = conn.createStatement(); s.executeUpdate( "CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_FREEZE_DATABASE()"); //copy the database directory during this interval s.executeUpdate( "CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_UNFREEZE_DATABASE()"); s.close(); }
